title: Chickens pt 4: There is No Such Thing as Cheap Food -- Industrial vs. Agrarian Agriculture
description:
Wrapping up my chicken series by putting the home food and yard economy into the larger context of our industrialized food system.
Wolves in Yellowstone: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ysa5OBhXz-Q
Wendell Berry, The Land, The People, and a Proper Economy: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hstD5UPkWQM
Holistic management: https://savory.global/,  https://holisticmanagement.org/
By happy coincidence, the day after I recorded this, what should show up in my notifications but this great interview with Rattan Lal, Ph.D, Professor of Soil Physics in the School of Environment and Natural Resources at The Ohio State University, talking about, of all things (!) compensating farmers for ecological services. This is sciency, but even if you don’t get the chemistry, I think you’ll get the main point: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N7QuG7NmCbc 
The hidden price tag of industrial agriculture: Karen Hudson at TEDxManhattan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pRE9HA0sJMM
How Corporations Ruined Food (Food Industry Documentary) | Real Stories: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5RwIWGkMxrE
Factory farms, antibiotics and superbugs: Lance Price at TEDxManhattan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZwHapgrF99A
How Diet Is Driving COVID-19 Outcomes, Mark Hyman, MD: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r__rOU2G_P8
